intro: Echites grandis, commonly known as the giant echites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its foliage is typically broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
